intro: Pancalum, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Pancalum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
